TopicTitle: Option to reduce time to maneuver node?

Articles.Content:
What do people think about reducing the time the maneuver node time warp moves to? When automatically time warping to a maneuver node, it takes me to within 30 seconds of the node. Personally I would like it to take me closer to 10s because I have no patience.


Actually. I'd be kind of nice if that was something we could set in the options.
most of the time it wont work properly anyways and warp you to anything between 40 seconds and 3 minutes before the node
I submitted a suggestion: when pressing the >>> button again the time should go to 00:05 s.
That suggestion seems reasonable. The issue with making the time shorter without a 2nd button click would be that people may not have their vessel aligned to the maneuver node yet.

It usually stops once at 02:30, then if you press it again it goes to 00:30 (here you can start aligning) and if you're done.. we should be able to press it again to go to 00:05.

Also I really miss persistent rotation.

Speaking of persistent rotation, I miss that too, and I think the lack of rotation in time warp will hold back the non-impulsive nodes. The lack of being able to keep your direction pro-grade makes burning in time-warp problematic. Right now you can enter a pro-grade burn with a low TWR engine that will lead you into crashing into the planet from a stable orbit (since pro-grade becomes retrograde at some point into the burn). It's still one of the biggest draws of KSP 2, but the usability in low orbits will be limited if it stays like this.

But that's a different topic.
